author: COMSOL
description:
Geothermal heating is an environmentally friendly and energy efficient method to supply newer and well insulated houses with heat. To cut heating costs, there is need to investigate ways of arranging heat collectors in the subsurface.

This model compares three different arrangements, embedded in the subsurface of the top soil layer in a garden using the Pipe Flow Module. Typical thermal properties of the soil layer are obtained using data import from measurements.
label: ground_heat_recovery.mph
name: root
